avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Limited snow cover expected, insufficient for an avalanche hazard.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Limited snow cover expected, insufficient for an avalanche hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Frequent showers, prolonged at times. The colder air remains in place with snow showers above about 400m at first then above 800 metres later in the day. Staying windy with gale force West-North-Westerly winds, stronger over the higher summits.
Observed Weather Influences: Last night and through today storm Pia brought severe gale force WNW winds to the area with gusts of more than 85 mph. During the latter part of the morning the freezing level lowered to around 900 metres and light snow fell mainly above 850 metres this is currently only a dusting over the higher summits and is not significant enough for an avalanche hazard.
ObservedSnowStability: Insufficient snow.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Isolated accumulations of windslab will build in wind sheltered locations on North through East to South aspects above 900m.  Areas most affected will be gully tops and steep corrie headwalls. These accumulations are expected to be shallow and generally avoidable. Fragile cornices will develop on the same aspects. Elsewhere the remaining snow patches will remain hard/icy and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 22.12 Isolated windslab on N through E to S aspects above 900m. Elsewhere stable. Avalanche Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Gale to storm force West-North-West winds will continue. Frequent snow showers. The freezing level will fluctuate around 600 - 800m.
Observed Weather Influences: Storm Force West-North-Westerly winds.  Freezing level around 800 meters.  Snow showers in the afternoon.
ObservedSnowStability: A dusting of fresh snow was observed on West though North to East aspects above 800 metres.  Patches of firm, well bonded and stable snow remain on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 900 metres.   The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area until the situation changes. Go to the blog for area photos and general information which is being provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO: 22/12. No avalanche hazard forecast due to lack of snow. See SAIS blog for more mountain condition details.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: 
Observed Weather Influences: 
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area until the situation changes. Go to the blog for area photos and general information which is being provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: In most areas there will be a thin covering of fresh snow on bare ground.  Localised areas of new unstable windslab will develop on North-East through East to South aspects above 750 metres. These accumulations are not expected to be extensive and will generally overlie bare ground. Areas most affected will be wind sheltered areas such as coire rims and gully tops. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TO for 22/12 Localised areas of shallow windslab. NE,E,SE,S above 750m. Not extensive. Low hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Snow showers throughout the period will fall as snow above around 600 metres. Very strong West-North-Westerly winds. The freezing level will be around 700 metres with a slightly warmer spell around dawn.
Observed Weather Influences: A mainly dry morning, scattered showers fell as snow above 600 metres during the afternoon. Storm force North-Westerly winds eased slightly through the day. The freezing level is around 750 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Only a few very small patches of old snow remain. No significant accumulations of new snow.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Isolated windslab will develop in steep, wind sheltered locations such as gully tops on East to South aspects above 900 metres. Instabilities will be present where these deposits achieve depth and overlie the remaining older and re-frozen snow cover. At lower altitudes and other aspects the new snow will settle on to bare ground. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 22.12 Isolated, shallow windslab developing in gully tops on E, SE, S aspect above 900m. Avalanche Hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: The freezing level will be around 700 metres overnight. It will rise during the morning to summit levels, then lower again to 700 metres by the end of the forecast period. Light precipitation, falling as snow is expected throughout. The winds will be very strong North-Westerlies.
Observed Weather Influences: Overnight rainfall at all levels, turning to snow showers as the freezing level dropped to around 700 metres. The winds were gale and occasionally storm force North-Westerlies.
ObservedSnowStability: Shallow windslab is developing only in steep, wind sheltered locations such as gully tops mainly on East to South aspects above 1000 metres. Elsewhere, there is a dusting of new snow. Older snow is firm and well-bonded. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area until the situation changes. Go to the Blog and Mountain Info for area photos; area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.
avalancheActivity.highlights: CM for 22.12 No avalanche hazard forecast due to lack of snow. See SAIS Blog for photos and mountain conditions information

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Winds will be very strong West-North-Westerly. Scattered light showers are expected, falling as snow mainly above 700 metres. The freezing level will be around 700 metres overnight, briefly rising to 1000 metres around dawn and then 800 metres during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: Very strong generally Westerly winds. Light scattered showers, falling as snow to lower levels during the day (to 750 metres mid-afternoon). The freezing level dropped to around 800 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Currently there is insufficient snow cover to present any avalanche hazard and avalanche reports will not be issued for this area until the situation changes. Go to the Blog and Mountain Info for area photos; area info will be provided by SAIS forecasters on a daily basis.
